>
[Undead Scourge](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1577)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 91

**Price** 350 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)
</row>

**Access** Knights of Lastwall have access to this item.

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

An undead scourge is a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [disrupting](/Equipment.aspx?ID=294) [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)_ with a bluish-white metal blade that emits a faint glow. These used to be weapons of [Pharasmin](/Deities.aspx?ID=14) undead slayers only, but the slayers have since shared these daggers with the Knights of Lastwall.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> Interact;  **Frequency** once per hour; **Trigger** You damage an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creature with the _undead scourge_;  **Effect** You disrupt the undead's connection to negative energy. For 1 minute, the undead damaged with the dagger can't be healed by negative energy unless the effect attempting to heal the undead first [counteracts](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the _undead scourge's_ effect, with a counteract level of 4 and DC of 25. Positive energy still has the usual effects on the undead.

</column>
